references.paper_title: Overcoming catastrophic forgetting in neural networks
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of continual learning, introducing the catastrophic forgetting problem and several mitigation techniques.

references.paper_title: On tiny episodic memories in continual learning
references.reason: This paper proposes a highly efficient method using episodic memory for continual learning, which is crucial for addressing the efficiency concerns in real-world OCL settings.

references.paper_title: Dark experience for general continual learning: a strong, simple baseline
references.reason: This paper introduces a simple yet effective baseline for continual learning, highlighting the importance of using dark experience to enhance model generalization and reduce catastrophic forgetting.

references.paper_title: Supervised contrastive replay: Revisiting the nearest class mean classifier in online class-incremental continual learning
references.reason: This paper revisits the nearest class mean classifier and introduces the supervised contrastive replay technique for online class-incremental learning, which effectively addresses the challenge of class imbalance and improves classification performance.

references.paper_title: Prevalence of neural collapse during the terminal phase of deep learning training
references.reason: This paper introduces the neural collapse phenomenon, which helps explain the behavior of deep learning models in various continual learning scenarios, providing insights into the process of model generalization and performance improvement.
